The East Bernard City Park The East Bernard City Park officially opened on May 30th, 2015. It is a wonderful site to see. Visit the park to enjoy it's wonderful amenities. You can play soccer on our gorgeous field fit for any soccer player, or take a stroll on our trail that takes you on a scenic adventure to an outlook over the San Bernard River, serve up some volleyball on the sandy court, or shoot some hoops on the basketball court, or why not enjoy a good book in our breathtaking pavilion that is surrounded by a beautiful butterfly garden! The kids will have a wonderful time playing in our unique nature themed playground area and stay a while and enjoy your surroundings while you cook some burgers or dogs on the grills in the picnic area. The park is also home to the baseball stadium that is home to the East Bernard Brahmas! Park hours are dawn to 8:00 p.m. The pavilion is available to rent for birthday parties, showers, or any other small gathering. Please see the attached documents for further information on renting. For larger events or events sponsored by an organization, please see the City Secretary at East Bernard City Hall, 704 Church Street, East Bernard.

** SECTION V: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES & TABACCO USAGE-CITY ORDINANCES 1. Per City Ordinance (2015-006 Section 3(d)), alcoholic beverages are prohibited in City parks. 2. Per City Ordinance (2015-006 Section 3(e)), use of any tobacco product or e-cigarettes is prohibited in City Parks. 3. Per City Ordinance (2015-006 Section 3(g)), all dogs, cats, or livestock are prohibited in the City Park. Exceptions will be made for service animals used for medical purposes. 4. Per City Ordinance (2015-006 Section 3(c)), glass containers of any kind are prohibited in the City Park. 5. Violators are subject to a citation call!

The East Bernard City Pool The pool is a wonderful facility and provides so much fun for all ages! Our facility features a splash pad for the littles and a pool that is suitable for both those looking for leisure and a good workout! The East Bernard City Pool opens Memorial Day weekend and closes the first weekend August. Admission is $7 per day for each resident swimmer/ $10 non-residents, season passes are $75 residents/$100 non-residents. Family passes are available for $200.00 residents/$250.00 non-residents. Hours for the pool are Tuesday-Sunday: 2:00 p.m.-8:00 p.m. ***The pool will close at 6:00 p.m. when parties are scheduled (parties are scheduled Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays).

Water aerobics Tuesdays and Thursdays from 8:00 p.m.-9:00 p.m.
